    • Method Detail

      • getEventsForHourAsStream

        public java.io.InputStream getEventsForHourAsStream(java.util.Date date)
        Gets the events for the hour of the given date. This is a convenience method for: getEventsForTimeBucketAsStream(TimeBucketUtils.forHour(date))
        Parameters:
        date - the date to format as an hour time bucket.
        Returns:
        the stream containing the events as XML.
        See Also:
        #getEventsForTimeBucketAsStream(String), TimeBucketUtils.forHour(Date)

      • getEventsForMinuteAsStream

        public java.io.InputStream getEventsForMinuteAsStream(java.util.Date date)
        Gets the events for the hour of the given date. This is a convenience method for: getEventsForTimeBucketAsStream(TimeBucketUtils.forHour(date))
        Parameters:
        date - the date to format as an hour time bucket.
        Returns:
        the stream containing the events as XML.
        See Also:
        #getEventsForTimeBucketAsStream(String), TimeBucketUtils.forHour(Date)

      • getEventsForTimeBucketAsStream

        public java.io.InputStream getEventsForTimeBucketAsStream(java.util.Date date)
        Gets the event for the given time bucket, as a stream. A time bucket can be either an hour or a minute of any day, in the form of yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH for hour or yy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm for minute.

        API Call: GET /monitoring/events?time_bucket={timeBucket}

        Parameters:
        timeBucket - the time bucket for which to retrieve the events.
        Returns:
        the stream containing the events as XML. This must be closed by the client in order to release the connection.
